page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Langtree was originally owned by the Earls of Gloucester. After the Norman Conquest the manor was held by Matilda, the wife of William 1. An area known as Castle Gardens marks the site of an ancient castle. The church (undedicated) was built in the late 15th Century. During the 1500's the parish was owned by the Browne family _wealthy wool merchants who had lived many years in the area. One of the family, Brute Browne, was killed by the Spaniards of Puerto Rico in 1595 whilst sailing with Drake. In the early 1600's the manor was purchased by the Rolle Family of Stevenson House, Torrington who remained Lords of the Manor until the beginning of the present century.
